titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings 1940-1952
Milner (Lois) collection of broadcast radio audio recordings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid created by Ben Sandberg

publicationstmt.publisher: Multimedia Archives, J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah

profiledesc.creation: Encoded in Adobe Dreamweaver by Michael Hinderaker 2012.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid encoded in English in Latin script.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: University of Utah Libraries, Special Collections

did.unittitle: Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings
did.abstract: The Lois Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings contains 259 phonograph records of radio programs from 1940-1952. These programs cover a variety of topics but appear to mostly be targeted towards children, or related to school in some way.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1895, Marconi had the first succesful long distance radio transmission, spanning approximately 1.5 miles. As technology allowed radio to become a better communication and entertainment medium, it grew rapidly. By the 1940s, most households had a receiver and many commercially produced shows were available. Adaptations of written works, such as the "Children's Friend of the Air" programs in the Lois Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings were common as well.

scopecontent.p: The Lois Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings contains 135 cds of radio programs from 1940-1952. These programs cover a variety of topics but appear to mostly be targeted towards children, or related to school in some way. All records have been digitized and are available to listen to on the 135 compact discs detailed in this finding aid.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged in the order in which they were digitized.

accessrestrict.p: Materials must be used on-site; no use of original material, access copies will be made available for viewing. Five business days advanced notice required. Access to parts of this collection may be restricted under provisions of state or federal law, condition of the material, or by donor.

userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain any necessary copyright clearances.
Permission to publish material from the Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings must be obtained from the Special Collections Multimedia Archivist.

prefercite.p: Initial Citation: Lois Milner collection of broadcast radio audio recordings A1005, Special Collections and Archives. University of Utah, J. Willard Marriott. Salt Lake City, Utah.
